showerReviews.reviewText: This TA exudes a clean, vibrant New Mexico vibe. The colorful exterior leads to an interior filled with amazing art and a great selection for travelers and truckers. Dining options are adequate, and parking is spacious. Service is pleasant, ‚Ä¶

Really small squeegees to clean the windshield.
They still have paid parking here
It's right on the Texas, New Mexico border on interstate 40 ‚Ä¶

This was an incredible stop on our road trip! They truly have everything, a gas station, restaurant, convenience store, laundry facilities, and even a free car museum. It‚Äôs the ultimate one stop shop! The place was clean, the customer service was excellent, and overall, it was one of the best stops we‚Äôve experienced.

showerReviews.reviewerName: Full time explorer RV living (Living on the road!)
showerReviews.reviewText: The free car museum was a nice surprise, friendly staff lots of options for food, snacks, and drinks. However, the bathroom bathrooms are pretty gross and out of toilet paper..  One toilet was leaking on the floor. I did inform the staff when checking out.
showerReviews.uniqueId: Full time explorer RV living (Living on the road!)_The_free_car_museum_was_a_nice_surprise,_friendly__3 months ago

showerReviews.reviewText: The best TA I‚Äôve ever seen! It has everything you need, but what really surprised me was the atmosphere ‚Äî it feels like stepping into a movie. There‚Äôs a free museum inside and a great caf√© with delicious food. Very cozy, clean, and unique. I highly recommend stopping by, even if you weren‚Äôt planning to ‚Äî this place is truly worth it!
